The participants form a Management Trainee Committee which is asked to review various issues so that senior management can gauge views from the junior management population. The issues to be reviewed by the committee include opportunities for training and career development, the launch of a company-wide customer service award scheme, flexi-time working and a suggestion for cutting costs. Participants must work together to produce appropriate recommendations.

Participants assume the role of a Trainee Business Analyst working for a global consultancy, which specializes in providing financial data and market intelligence to their clients. A client has asked for information on five different products to be analysed in order to decide which product to invest in and launch. Participants are presented with comprehensive information about the market, customers, competitors and the five products in question and must make recommendations having analysed all available information.
The following rating scale has been employed for the behavioural feedback:
This is likely to be a very clear strength.
This is likely to be an area of strength.
- This is observed when there is a wide disparity between the scores in two (or all three) exercises).
